candidates.name: Victoria Del La Varis-Woodcock
candidates.why_elect: For more than two decades living in the Kaipara district my academic, community and professional work has focused on sustainability as an economic principle we need to follow. I have proven political experience, which I will put to use to get results for our communities.
candidates.why_stand: I want to put my skills and local government experience into action for our great Kaipara communities.

candidates.name: Joesephine Nathan
candidates.why_elect: I bring would bring a fresh energy focusing on the wellbeing of whānau, communities and the environment. Everything I have done from Gumboot Friday, rode from Rotorua to Wellington an the Pouto Lighthouse Challenge has been for charity, I am passionate and action orientated and focused on community voice.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for election because I am passionate about our community and want to see our region thrive. The voice of the community is a key component in creating a stronger network. When people feel that they are being heard it can create a positive outcome.

candidates.name: David Wills
candidates.why_stand: With my many years of business and management experience I believe I can contribute to a successful future for our Kaipara District while carefully managing our current income we need to look at growing our local economy creating jobs and the pride that with that. David Wills voice of experience.
